DataElement.preferredName: Patient Prior Enrollment Endocrine Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating a patient meets the eligibility criteria for participation in a clinical trial regarding the receipt of endocrine therapy prior to study enrollment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Prior Enrollment Endocrine Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Earlier in time or order._The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled._Various treatment modalities that produce the desired therapeutic effect by means of change of hormone/hormones level._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Prior Enrollment Endocrine Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.:Various treatment modalities that produce the desired therapeutic effect by means of change of hormone/hormones level.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.
Various treatment modalities that produce the desired therapeutic effect by means of change of hormone/hormones level.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient received hormonal
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received hormonal therapy for treatment of their cancer within 2 weeks of study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received hormone therapy less than 2 weeks prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior hormonal therapy within 14 days or five half-lives of the compound or active metabolites, whichever is longer, before the first dose of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled in the randomized phase II portion, has resistance to prior endocrine therapy in the metastatic setting been demonstrated?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient been off hormone therapy for breast cancer for 2 weeks prior to the initiation of study treatment and must have recovered to less than or equal to Grade 1 from any adverse events related to these therapies (other than alopecia)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received any prior hormone therapy for the treatment of their prostate cancer, except limited androgen receptor antagonist therapy, defined as less than or equal to 3 days of treatment which has been discontinued within 5 half-lives of the compound prior to study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled to the randomized Phase 2 portion of this study, did patient demonstrate resistance to prior endocrine therapy in the metastatic setting defined by the following:  Progressed on prior endocrine therapy in the metastatic setting or, Relapsed on adjuvant endocrine therapy or, Relapsed within 12 months of completing adjuvant endocrine therapy or, If received adjuvant CDK4/6 inhibitor, relapsed at least 2 years after completion of adjuvant CDK4/6 inhibitor?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has hormone-receptor positive disease, has patient  progressed on at least one prior line of hormone therapy and a CDK4/6 inhibitor in the metastatic setting (except if patient had a contraindication or intolerable toxicity with the use of these agents)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has hormone-receptor positive disease, has patient received at least one line of hormone therapy in the metastatic setting?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is it being managed with replacement hormones including physiologic corticosteroids?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received short-acting somatostatin analogs within 24 hours prior to initiating Lutetium Lu 177 dotatate and during treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient receiving treatment with only sex hormone inhibitors?
